document.name: Oculus.txt
document.plainText:
META QUEST
Oculus Privacy Policy
Last updated: 15 June 2023

This Privacy Policy applies to you if you use an Oculus account to access Meta VR Products. If you use your Facebook or Meta account to access Meta VR Products, please visit the Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy to learn about how we collect, use and share your information.

Meta offers virtual, mixed and augmented reality ("XR") hardware and software products, and operates a platform under the Meta Quest brand where users can download, interact with and submit content and obtain services related to or in connection with our XR products (collectively, the "Meta VR Products"). We describe our Meta VR Products, including our websites, mobile apps, platform, content, hardware, services and any product or service that links to this Oculus Privacy Policy – in our Oculus Terms of Service. This Privacy Policy explains how we treat information from or about you, including how we collect, use and share information on our Meta VR Products.

1. What kind of information do we collect?
Depending on which Meta VR Products you use, we must process different kinds of information from or about you. Here's how:

Information you (and others) give us. We collect the information that you (and others) give us when using Meta VR Products. For example:

When you register to use Meta VR Products, we ask for information such as your name, email address and phone number.

You will have the ability to add information to your profile after registration.

If you update your profile with payment information or buy something on or through our Meta VR Products, we collect information about the transaction, including your payment information, purchase activity, and delivery and contact details.

We collect information about the people, content and experiences that you connect to and how you interact with them across our Meta VR Products.

When you post, share or communicate with us or other users on our Meta VR Products, we receive and store those communications and information associated with them, such as the date a post was created.

When you communicate with us, you provide us with information such as your email address.

Depending on which Oculus services you use, you have the option of submitting information about your physical features and dimensions.

We collect content that you create using Meta VR Products, such as your avatar, a picture that you post or an object that you sculpt, and information about this content, such as the date and time that you created the content.

We also collect content and information that other people provide when they use Meta VR Products. This can include information about you, such as when they send us an abuse report that refers to or contains video of you.

Information automatically collected about you when you use Meta VR Products. We also collect information automatically when you are connected to the Meta VR Products. Depending on how you access and use Meta VR Products, we collect information such as:

Information about your interactions with Meta VR Products, such as information about the people, games, content, apps, features or other experiences that you interact with, including information collected through or from content provided by our third-party partners. For example, we receive information about in-app purchases that you have made in a game provided by a third-party developer;

Information collected in or through cookies, local storage, pixels and similar technologies (additional information about these technologies is available at https://www.meta.com/legal/quest/cookies-pixels-and-other-technologies/);

Information about how you access our Meta VR Products, including information about the type of device that you're using (such as a headset, PC, TV, mobile or other connected device), its configuration (such as your operating system and graphics processing unit), your browser, Internet Protocol ("IP") address and how your device is performing;

Information about the features that you interact with on the Meta VR Products. For example, we receive information about your Meta Quest Browser usage, such as interactions with recommended Pages, which browser features you use, crash reporting data and other statistics related to your Meta Quest Browser. You can learn more about how we collect and use information from other features that you interact with on the Meta VR Products in our Meta Quest Privacy FAQ;

Certain identifiers that are unique to you. These identifiers include device and other identifiers, such as those from games and apps you use;

Information about the games, content or other apps installed on your device or provided through the Meta VR Products, including from third parties;

Location-related information, which can be derived from information such as your device's IP address. If you're using a mobile device, some of our Meta VR Products collect information about the device's precise location, which is derived from sources such as the device's GPS signal and information about nearby Wi-Fi networks and cell towers;

Information about your environment, physical movements and dimensions when you use an XR device. For example, when you set up the Meta Quest Guardian System to alert you when you approach a boundary, we receive information about the play area that you have defined; and when you enable the hand tracking feature, we collect technical information such as your estimated hand size and hand movement data to enable this feature.

Information we receive through device settings that you choose, such as your photos or audio content;

Technical system information such as crash logs, which may contain your user ID, the device ID, the IP address, the local computer file path, the feature quality, the amount of time it takes to load a feature and whether you use a certain feature.

Information from related companies and third parties. We also receive information about you from Meta and third parties:

We receive information about you from Meta to promote safety, integrity and security across the Meta Products.

We also receive information about you from third parties, including third-party apps, developers, other online content providers and marketing partners that provide us with information. For example, we receive information from developers about your achievements in their app and share that information with your friends on Meta Quest. We may also get information from companies or organisations that provide content such as videos, photos and audio.

You can learn how to access, correct and delete information that we collect by visiting the Privacy Centre.

2. How do we use information?
We use the information as set out below and to provide our Meta VR Products to you and our partners. Here's how:

To provide and personalise our Meta VR Products. We use the information that we collect to provide you with our Meta VR Products. For example, we use this information to:

Provide you with hardware, content, games, apps and other experiences;

Create accounts and user profiles;

Communicate with you about our Meta VR Products;

Enable certain features, such as hand tracking;

Enable content understanding and creation capabilities;

Enable user-to-user communications and other related services;

Provide technical support;

Notify you about updates to our Meta VR Products; and

Customise your experiences on our Meta VR Products based on your activities, including the content, games, apps and other experiences that you interact with, the other online services you use and other information that we collect. This allows us to make your experience unique and relevant to you, for example by showing you content that is most relevant to you.

To improve and develop your experience and our Meta VR Products. We also use the information that we collect to understand and improve our Meta VR Products and to develop the XR ecosystem. For example, we use the information to:

Solicit and analyse input and feedback about our Meta VR Products;

Identify and address technical issues on our Meta VR Products;

Conduct and learn from research about the ways in which people use our Meta VR Products;

Improve our AI technologies and support AI research and product development, including content understanding and tools to create content;

Improve services offered by others, such as third parties that offer content, games, apps and other experiences on our Meta VR Products; and

Improve and develop our features, such as hand tracking. For example, for hand tracking, we collect technical information such as hand tracking quality, the amount of time it takes to detect your hands and the number of pinches that you make to improve and troubleshoot this feature.

To market to you. We use the information that we collect to send you promotional messages and content about Meta VR Products and Meta Quest-related experiences on and off our Meta VR Products. We also use this information to measure how users respond to our marketing efforts. If you would like to opt out of receiving marketing emails, please visit the Privacy Centre.

To promote safety, integrity and security. We use the information that we collect to verify accounts and activity, combat harmful conduct, detect and prevent bad experiences, maintain the integrity of our Meta VR Products and promote safety and security on and off our Meta VR Products. For example, we use information collected to investigate suspicious activity or violations of our terms or policies, detect when someone needs help and protect our or others' rights or property.

3. How is information shared?
Our Meta VR Products help you engage with the XR ecosystem and others who interact with it. To provide and support our Meta VR Products, information that we have about you is shared in certain circumstances. Here is who can see information about you when you and others use our Meta VR Products.

People and accounts that you share and communicate with on our Meta VR Products. When you share, interact and communicate using our Meta VR Products, you choose the audience for what you share. For example, when you share a photo or other content in a shared or public virtual space, other people who visit the space may be able to see it.

Public information. Certain information that you post to your Meta Quest profile, such as your Meta Quest ID (also known as your Meta Quest Username) and avatar, will be public and visible to people on and off our Meta VR Products. Your Meta Quest ID is a unique identifier that you choose to identify yourself on our Meta VR Products.
Information that you post to public areas of our Meta VR Products, such as a forum, blog or other community tool, will also be visible to people on and off our Meta VR Products. If you post information to these interactive features, it will be publicly available. Certain information associated with your public posts, such as the time of your post, will also be published and publicly available.

Content others share about you. You should consider who you choose to share with, because people who are able to see your activity, content or information on our Meta VR Products may choose to share it with others on and off our Meta VR Products. For example, when you interact with others in a multiplayer game, another player could choose to livestream that experience – including what you are doing in the game – to Meta. People may also use Meta VR Products to share content about you that they have obtained from other sources.

Apps, developers and other online content providers on our Meta VR Products. You can interact with third-party content, games, apps and other experiences through our Meta VR Products. We share information about you with these partners so that they can provide you with the experiences that you've requested, such as:

Information in your Oculus profile and about how you use our Meta VR Products. For example, we make available to third-party developers a list of your friends who also use the developer's app so that they can offer to pair you in a game or other experience within their app, or rank your scores and achievements in that app against your friends' scores and achievements. We also share information about individual abuse reports or abuse statistics on our Meta VR Products, so we can help develop a safe and enjoyable XR ecosystem.

Information about your interaction with the third-party service, such as how long you have interacted with content.

Any other information that you choose to share with the third party.

Third-party content providers may also collect information from you directly through the experiences they provide. Please note that any information you share with these or other) third parties will be subject to those third parties' own privacy policies, not this one.

Sharing within related companies. We share information with related companies, including Meta, depending on which services you use, including to promote safety, integrity and security across the Meta Company Products. For example, if you buy something on or through the Meta VR Products, we share your information with Meta Platforms Technologies Ireland Limited to process your payment and detect, prevent or otherwise address fraud, security or technical issues in accordance with the Meta Quest Store Terms. We also share information with Meta Platforms Technologies, LLC and Meta Platforms Technologies Ireland Limited to conduct and support research and innovation to further the state-of-the-art or academic understanding of XR technology.

Service providers. We share the information that we collect with vendors, service providers, researchers and other partners, who work at our direction to support the Meta VR Products (such as hosting our Meta VR Products, fulfilling orders, facilitating payments, analysing the way people use our Meta VR Products, processing credit card payments, providing customer service or sending electronic communications for us).

Other parties in connection with certain business transactions. In the event that the ownership of Meta (or any portion of our assets) changes as a result of a merger, acquisition or in the event of a bankruptcy, information from or about you or your device will be transferred to another company.

Permission. We share your information for any other purpose you choose.

Law enforcement or legal requests. We share information with law enforcement or in response to legal requests in the circumstances outlined in Section 7 below.

We also share de-identified or aggregate data with others. De-identified data means information where we have removed your name and other data that could reasonably be used to identify you. Aggregate data is data that has been combined with other data so that it doesn't identify any specific person. For example, we provide developers with aggregated statistics about the number of people from a particular region that use our Meta VR Products, so developers can create content tailored for people in that market

4. How Oculus works with the rest of Meta .
We share infrastructure, systems and technology with the rest of Meta (which includes Instagram and WhatsApp) to provide an innovative, relevant, consistent and safe experience across all Meta Products that you use. We also process information about you across Meta for these purposes, as permitted by applicable law and in accordance with their terms and policies. For example, we use information about bad actors on Meta Quest to fight spam or abuse on other Meta Products such as Instagram. We also work to understand how people use and interact with Meta Products, such as understanding the number of unique users on different Meta Products.

5. Third parties that provide content, marketing or functionality on our services
Some of the content, marketing and functionality on our Meta VR Products is provided by third parties that are not affiliated with us. For example, we work with companies that help us understand how people use our Meta VR Products.

Other companies may collect information on or through our Meta VR Products to market to you on or off our Meta VR Products. These and other third parties may collect information about your use of our Meta VR Products, including through the use of cookies, device IDs, local storage, pixels and other technologies, and this information may be collected over time and combined with information collected on different websites and online services.

6. Data retention and deletion
We store Meta Quest data that identifies you until it is no longer necessary to provide our Meta VR Products or your Oculus account is deleted, whichever comes first, unless retention of the data for a longer period is justified in order to comply with law or recordkeeping obligations, to respond to a legal request, prevent harm or to improve our safety, integrity and security features. This is determined on a case-by-case basis that depends on things such as the nature of the data, why it is collected and processed, and relevant legal, integrity or operational retention needs. For example, we retain certain purchase information for accounting and tax purposes even after you have deleted your account.

When you delete your account, we delete things you have posted and information about apps and entitlements you have downloaded, and you will not be able to recover that information later. Information that others have shared about you is not part of your account and will not be deleted when you delete your account. To delete your account at any time, or to learn more about deleting your account, please visit the Privacy Centre.

7. How do we respond to legal requests and prevent harm?
We access, preserve and share information with regulators, law enforcement agencies or others:

In response to a legal request if we have a good faith belief that the law requires us to do so. We can also respond to legal requests where we have a good faith belief that the response is required by law in that jurisdiction, affects users in that jurisdiction and is consistent with internationally recognised standards.

When we have a good faith belief that it is necessary to: detect, prevent and address fraud or other illegal activity; to protect Meta, our Meta VR Products, you and others, including as part of investigations; or to prevent death or imminent bodily harm. For example, if relevant, we exchange information with third-party partners about the reliability of your Oculus account to prevent fraud, abuse and other harmful activity on and off of our Meta VR Products.

Information that we receive about you, including financial transaction data related to purchases made on or through our Meta VR Products, can be accessed, processed and retained for an extended period when it is the subject of a legal request or obligation, governmental investigation or investigations concerning possible violations of our terms or policies, or otherwise to prevent harm. We also retain information from Oculus accounts disabled for violations of our terms for at least a year to prevent repeat abuse or other term violations.

8. How we operate and transfer data as part of our global services
We share information globally, both internally within Meta, and externally with our partners and with those you connect and share with around the world in accordance with this Policy. Information controlled by Meta Platforms Ireland Limited will be transferred or transmitted to, or stored and processed in the United States or other countries outside of where you live for the purposes as described in this Policy. These data transfers are necessary to provide the services set forth in the Terms of Service and to globally operate and provide our Meta VR Products to you. We use standard contract clauses approved by the European Commission, and rely on the European Commission's adequacy decisions about certain countries, as applicable, for data transfers from the EEA to the United States and other countries.

9. How will we notify you of changes to this policy?
If we make changes to this Privacy Policy, we will provide notice of such changes as appropriate, such as by sending you an email notification to the address you've provided, and/or providing notice through the Meta VR Products. If we make an administrative change, we will update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this Privacy Policy

10. Contacting us
The data controller responsible for your information is Meta Platforms Ireland Limited, which you can contact online or by post at:

Meta Platforms Ireland Limited FAO:

Privacy Operations

4 Grand Canal Square, Grand Canal Harbour

Dublin 2, Ireland

You may also contact the Data Protection Officer for Meta Platforms Ireland Limited. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with our lead supervisory authority, the Irish Data Protection Commissioner or with your local supervisory authority.

11. What is our legal basis for processing data?
We collect, use and share the data that we have, as described here:

as necessary to fulfil our Terms of Service;

consistent with your consent, which you may revoke at any time;

as necessary to comply with our legal obligations;

occasionally to protect your vital interests or those of others;

as necessary in the public interest; and

as necessary for our (or others') legitimate interests, unless those interests are overridden by your interests or fundamental rights and freedoms that require protection of personal data.

Learn more about these legal bases and how they relate to the ways in which we process data.

12. How can you exercise your rights provided under the GDPR?
Under the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to access, rectify, port and delete your data, as well as the right to restrict and object to certain processing of your data. This includes:

The right to object to our processing of your data for direct marketing; and

The right to object to our processing of your data where we are performing a task in the public interest or pursuing our legitimate interests or those of a third party.

Find out more about these rights and how you can exercise them in the sections above and in our Privacy Centre.


SUPPLEMENTARY TEXT FROM EXTERNAL PAGES LINKED IN THE PRIVACY POLICY

 Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy Legal Bases for Meta VR Products

We collect, use and share your data in the ways described in accordance with the Meta Privacy Policy under the "What is our legal basis for processing your information, and what are your rights?" section.

In the Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy, we explain the additional information we process to support Meta VR Products under the "What information do we collect for Meta VR Products?" section and provide more details about how we process this information under the "How do we use your information for Meta VR Products?" section. We also specify the categories of recipients with whom we share personal data in the section entitled "How is your information shared with others for Meta VR Products?"
Our legal bases for processing personal data



Our legal basis for collecting and using the personal data described in the Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy will depend on the personal data concerned and the specific context in which we collect it. However, we will normally collect personal data from you only:

    - where we need such personal data to perform contractual obligations to you (or take steps at your request prior to entering into a contract with you); or

    - where the processing is in our legitimate interests and not overridden by your rights and freedoms. If we collect and use your personal data based on our legitimate interests (or those of any third party), such interests generally will be as specified in the table further below. We may have other legitimate interests, which we will make clear to you at the relevant time, as applicable. 

When we process data that you provide to us based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time and to port that data you provide to us, under the GDPR. To exercise your rights, visit the Meta Quest Privacy Centre. Your withdrawal of consent will not affect the lawfulness of processing that takes place prior to your withdrawal.

In some instances, we may also need to process personal data to comply with a legal obligation or may otherwise need personal data to carry out a task in the public interest or protect your vital interests or those of another person. See the Meta Privacy Policy under "What is our legal basis for processing your information, and what are your rights?" for more information.

Below, we provide more information on the purposes for which we process your personal data as described in the Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy and the legal bases that we rely on:

PURPOSES AND LEGAL BASES / TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA / SOURCE 
______________________________________

PURPOSES AND LEGAL BASES
Purpose: Providing the Meta VR Products, including their functions

This also includes ensuring that the Meta VR Products operate in accordance with how they were described to you, for example, that they operate as described and, where applicable, that their functions are personalised to your use

Legal basis: Contractual necessity pursuant to (and in accordance with) our Terms of Service

To the extent that you are under the age of majority (under 18, in most applicable countries) and have limited ability to enter into an enforceable contract, we rely on our legitimate interest to provide the Meta VR Products
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA: 
    - Information you provide when you interact with the Meta VR Products (including their features), including information about your use of the Meta VR Products. For example, payment credentials that you provide to us, your virtual reality activity, the apps you download, the events you attend, the purchases you make, and the frequency and duration of your activities on the Meta VR Products 
    - Content you create, such as a picture you post, an object you build and information about this content, such as the date and time you created the content 
    - Technical system information about the devices that you use and information about how you use Meta VR Products, such as performance and device attributes, system logs and settings, success or failure of specific functions and crash reports (which include date and time of the crash, your user ID, device ID, IP address and small fragments of information from any camera and microphone in use at the time of the crash) 
    - Information about the use of third-party services that you access using the Meta VR Products, including how often and for how long they are used, crash log information when they crash and an authorisation token, if they require a login 

SOURCE:
All Meta VR Products users
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information you provide when you create a Meta account, including your name, contact information, password and date of birth 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that create a Meta account
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information you provide when you create a Meta Horizon profile, such as your profile name, profile picture, username, avatar, list of followers and interactions with games and apps 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that create a Meta Horizon profile
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Voice interactions 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products with assistant voice services
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Camera (including photo and video) and audio information 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that enable their cameras and/or microphone
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Gameplay activity and statistics, such as how successfully you play a game, actions in the game and associated metadata 

SOURCE:
Users of games on Meta VR Products
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information about your physical characteristics and movements 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that use features that, in order to function properly, need to collect information about the position and orientation of your headset and controllers, speed of your controller movement and audio data to animate your avatar's movement

___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information about your environment and dimensions 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that activate features that, in order to function properly, need to collect environmental data and dimensions in order to work (for example: information about the size of walls, surfaces and objects in your room and the distances between them and your headset to offer experiences that blend your virtual and real-world environments)
___________

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information about your fitness activities, such as the number of calories you've burned, how long you've been physically active and your fitness goals and achievements;
    - you can also choose to provide demographic information, such as height, weight and gender, so we can better estimate your fitness achievements 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that enable fitness-related experiences
______________________________________

PURPOSES AND LEGAL BASES:
Purpose: To power social features and personalise and promote content in connection with the Meta VR Products

Legal basis: Contractual necessity pursuant to (and in accordance with) our Terms of Service

To the extent that you are under the age of majority (under 18, in most applicable countries) and have limited ability to enter into an enforceable contract, we rely on our legitimate interest to personalise the Meta VR Products

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information collected for providing the Meta VR Products (see above) 

SOURCE:
All Meta VR Products users
______________________________________

PURPOSES AND LEGAL BASES:
Purpose: Providing certain features of the Meta VR Products

Legal basis: Our legitimate interest to provide you with engaging virtual, mixed and augmented reality experiences that rely on these features

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Information about your physical features and dimensions when you enable the hand and body tracking, eye tracking, natural facial expressions and fit adjustment features 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that use features such as Meta Quest's hand and body tracking, eye tracking, natural facial expressions and fit adjustment features
______________________________________

PURPOSES AND LEGAL BASES:
Purpose: To improve and further personalise your experience

Legal basis: Our legitimate interest to improve and further personalise your experience on Meta VR products

TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA:
    - Additional data collected about how you use Meta VR Products 

SOURCE:
Users of Meta VR Products that choose to share additional data with Meta

Technical system information such as crash logs, which may contain your user ID, the device ID, the IP address, the local computer file path, the feature quality, the amount of time it takes to load a feature and whether you use a certain feature.

We also receive information about you from Meta and third parties:

We receive information about you from Meta to promote safety, integrity and security across the Meta Products.
We also receive information about you from third parties, including third-party apps, developers, other online content providers and marketing partners that provide us with information.
For example, we receive information from developers about your achievements in their app and share that information with your friends on Meta Quest.
We may also get information from companies or organisations that provide content such as videos, photos and audio.
